subject: CSS
question: In the line 1 enter the definition of Pseudo-element and in the following lines write examples of pseudo-elements
answer:
1. A pseudo-element acts as if you had added a whole new HTML element into the markup, rather than applying a class to existing elements. Pseudo-elements usually start with a double colon ::

::after
::before
::first-letter
::first-line
::grammar-error
::selection
::spelling-error
